<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 14"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Mountain Quake](/Feats.aspx?ID=6033) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Monk" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=656" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 126 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Archetypes** [Martial Artist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=67) (Level 16), [Martial Artist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=255) (Level 16)

**Prerequisites**
[Mountain Stronghold](/Feats.aspx?ID=6002)

**Requirements**
You are in Mountain Stance. 

</column>

---

You stomp, shaking the earth beneath you. Creatures on the ground within a 20-foot emanation take damage equal to your Strength modifier (minimum 0), with a [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save against your class DC. On a failure, they also fall [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=88). After you use this action, you can't use it again for 1d4 rounds.

**Special** If you have this feat, the Dexterity modifier cap to your AC while using Mountain Stance increases from +1 to +2.
name: Mountain Quake
